abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column discusses runners who have competed in New York City Marathon for at least 15 consecutive years and are referred to by New York Road Runners as streakers; runners, many of whom are in their 60s and 70s and some who have logged upwards of 30 races, say they are driven to keep running race.
lead_paragraph: Those who have run the New York City Marathon again and again and again are known as streakers, and there are some rivalries among them over their longevity.

headline.main: These Competitors Measure Their Times in Years
headline.print_headline: These Competitors Measure Their Times in Years

snippet: Those who have run the New York City Marathon again and again and again are known as streakers, and there are some rivalries among them over their longevity.
